STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 24, 2023
Jennifer Savage
BENZIE/MANISTEE DHHS
1672 US-31 SOUTH S,
MANISTEE, MI, 49660-8942
RE: License#: CP510201273
Dear Ms. Savage:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on July 18, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Linda Tansil, Area Manager, at 248-860-0787.
Sincerely,
Douglas Turrill, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12510 Independent Living Contract
Rule 510. (1) There must be a mutual agreement
between the youth and the agency specifying all
the following:
(2) The agreement must be signed and dated by
the youth and the social service worker. The
agreement must be reviewed with the youth at
least once every 90 calendar days and a copy
provided to the youth.
One of one independent living files did not contain an updated independent living
contract. The last signed and dated contract was February 2, 2023.
FOM 722-801-03 Medical Passport
All medical information within the medical passport
must be current and updated at least quarterly to
reflect the child's current and complete health
information.

Three foster care files were reviewed. One of three files conatined a medical
passport that was not updated.The last passport was dated February 17, 2023. A
well child exam dated March 14, 2023 and a dental exam dated March 31, 2023
were not documented on an updated medical passport.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
• Technical assistance was not offered at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
• Consultation was not requested or offered at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted a corrective action plan on October 18, 2022, in response
to those violations established during the Interim Inspection completed on October
11, 2022. The current Renewal Inspection did not establish any repeat violations
indicating that their CAP was successful in preventing repeat violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators annual assessment was thorough and documented
quality reviews of cases. The assessment also addressed violations established
during the interim inspection completed in 2022.
Financial Overview
The agency is a local DHHS office therefore financial records were not available.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported feeling very supported by their supervisor. They reported that their
supervisor is also knowledgeable and can answer questions as needed, Staff
further reported that they are part of a supportive team that works well together.
Youth were not interviewed by the consultant.
Description of Agency Walk Through

The agency is a local DHHS office. The office is spacious, well organized and
maintained.
VII. CPA ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst did not find any safety concerns during her visits to the homes.
The CPA Analyst stated that foster parents and relatives reported that they are
satisfied with services the agency provides and they feel the agency is supportive of
them.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
July 24, 2023
_____________________________________
Douglas Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
July 25, 2023

Linda D Tansil Date
